subject: Philosophy
title: Greek Philosophy and Christianity
description: Learn Greek Philosophy and Christianity in one minute.

hook.text: Christianity didn't just borrow from Greek philosophy. It was built with Greek tools.

buildup.text: Early Church fathers used Plato's Forms and Aristotle's logic to explain Christian theology.

discovery.text: The Gospel of John opens: 'In the beginning was the Logos.' Logos is a Greek philosophical concept.

twist.text: Augustine fused Neoplatonism with Christianity. Aquinas fused Aristotle. Greek thought became the faith's backbone.

climax.text: Without Greek philosophy, Christian theology as we know it wouldn't exist.

punchline.text: Athens and Jerusalem built Western thought together.

quiz.question: How did Greek philosophy influence Christianity?
options: Church fathers used Greek concepts to develop Christian theology
